I-IV) For comparable texts see, e.g., Fries 1893, Worrel 1909, 1910, 1914-15, Dobberahn 1976, Burtea 2001.
VI) The text starts with the admonition “If there be anyone any one…” (MQ, Śǝrˁatä qǝddase, ch. III, §3) and ends witha portion of ˀAmaknǝyo zä-ḥawaryat, The Creed of the Apostles (fol. 79r-v
MQ, Śǝrˁatä qǝddase, ch. IV, §§31-40) followed by a portion of the ˀAmaknǝyo zä-śälästu mǝˀǝt, The Nicaean Creed (fol. 80r-v
I-IV) For comparable texts, see, e.g., Fries 1893, Worrel 1909, 1910, 1914-15, Dobberahn 1976, Burtea 2001

I) The text on fols. 4ra-24va corresponds to MQ, Śǝrˁatä qǝddase, ch. III and ch. IV, §30 followed by the Nicaean Creed (it preceeds Qǝddase śälästu mǝˀǝt in MQ)
the text on fol. 24ra-va corresponds to Śǝrˁatä qǝddase, ch. IV, §§53-61. For the translation, see the corresponding parts in Daoud 1954

II) See the Anaphoras in MQ (t.), Daoud 1954 (tr.). For a summary of the scholarly editions of Ethiopic Anaphoras, see Habtemichael Kidane 2003. In Text II-1 the passage with the reference to the Mäṣḥafä kidan is missing (its beginning corresponds to MQ, Qǝddase ˀƎgziˀǝnä, §2)
V) Cp. supplications in MQ, pp. 267-295 (t.)
I) Some sections of the text correspond to the passages in the edition Mäṣḥafä säˁatat 1959 EC.
III-8) Printed in Ludolf 1702:174 (Lib. VII, Cap. 3)
III-9) Printed in Ludolf 1702:170 (Lib. VII, Cap. 2), 171 (Lib. VII, Cap. 2.3.)
III-10) The second canticle on fol. 85r is printed in Ludolf 1702:169 (Lib. VII, Cap. 1.2)

Petrus Aethiops 1549. Modus baptizandi, preces et benedictiones quibus Ecclesia Ethiopum utitur, cum sacerdotes benedicunt puerperae unà cum infante Ecclesiam ingredienti, post quadragesimum puerperij diem. Item orationes quibus ijdem utuntur in sacramento baptismi et confirmationis. Item missa qua communiter utuntur, quae etiam canon uniuersalis appellatur nunc primum ex lingua Chaldea siue Aethiopica in Latinam conuersae (Romae: apud Antonium Bladum, 1549).
